definitions.text: the exposure of an impostor or a fraud
examples: he published an expose of the graft and corruption in city government

definitions.text: expose or make accessible to some action or influence
make known to the public information that was previously known only to a few people or that was meant to be kept a secret
examples: The auction house would not disclose the price at which the van Gogh had sold
The actress won't reveal how old she is
he broke the news to her
unwrap the evidence in the murder case

definitions.text: to show, make visible or apparent
examples: The Metropolitan Museum is exhibiting Goya's works this month
Why don't you show your nice legs and wear shorter skirts?
National leaders will have to display the highest skills of statesmanship

definitions.text: remove all or part of one's clothes to show one's body
examples: The man exposed himself in the subway

definitions.text: disclose to view as by removing a cover
examples: The curtain rose to disclose a stunning set

definitions.text: put in a dangerous, disadvantageous, or difficult position
expose to light, of photographic film
expose while ridiculing; especially of pretentious or false claims and ideas
examples: The physicist debunked the psychic's claims

definitions.text: abandon by leaving out in the open air
examples: The infant was exposed by the teenage mother
After Christmas, many pets get abandoned
